Comments_List: I developed knowledge of the technical dimensions of aid to Sub Saharan Africa and skills with text mining in R.
I learned about U.S. programs in Africa and the different technical dimensions of the problem that make it challenging to intervene. I also developed skills text mining in R.
I was introduced to text mining
The course requirements were rather light. Text mining assignments in conjunction with readings would have made them more useful.

The material was incredibly interesting and useful, and the text mining and assignments factored in to everything very seamlessly. My only suggestion is a little more structure on the instructions for assignments. Sometimes I felt like I wasn't sure what I need to be doing for some of the homeworks and projects.

This course could draw more on literature that addresses the subject matter of the course and that hopes to represent the standpoint of the local people. The experience of more countries in Africa could be presented in such literature. They could also be more closer working with students to ensure they development the relevant text mining skills

Definitely. I learned a lot and developed skills in text mining that I will use a lot going forward. No previous R experience is necessary, so anybody interested in this topic should definitely take the course.
I would recommend this course to someone hoping to learn to use text mining but not one who is more interested in the subject matter
